job_description: Tampere University and Tampere University of Applied Sciences create a unique environment for multidisciplinary, inspirational and high-impact research and education. Our universities community has its competitive edges in technology, health and society. www.tuni.fi/enThe Industrial Engineering and Management Unit (IEM) is looking to recruit a Postdoctoral Research Fellow, particularly in environmentally sustainable, circular industrial business. IEM is part of the Faculty of Management and Business (MAB) at Tampere University and offers education in the fields of engineering at the BSc, MSc and doctoral levels. Researchers at IEM are known for their broad and multidisciplinary collaboration that addresses the latest societal challenges. We take part in multidisciplinary projects with the different faculties and research groups at Tampere University and actively collaborate with other Finnish and international universities and research institutes.The successful candidate will work as a member of the Center for Innovation and Technology Research (CITER) and the CIRQ team within CITER.  The CIRQ team investigates the management of sustainable technology and innovation business, particular focus being in circular industrial-scale business. We conduct internationally acknowledged research, the main focuses being companiesâ business strategies and business and innovation management, at micro level and digitalization, value creation, collaborations, networks, and ecosystems at meso and macro level. The team has been among the forerunners in academic reach on circular economy business, and therefore it supports Finnish and international organizationsâ development and renewal towards a more environmentally sustainable mode of operations. We participate in the teaching of IEM at all levels in the content topics of the research group. The position links directly to the CIRQ teamâs following projects in the field of circular economy and climate neutral and carbon free business and society: CICAT2025, ReCreate, ILPO, SIE, UPCE, Profi4 of TAU, CircVol and CircHubs.Read more: https://www.tuni.fi/en/research/citer-center-innovation-and-technology-research Job description The position includes designing, conducting and leading research and teaching on circular economy and environmentally sustainable industrial business. Postdoctoral Research Fellow will perform the following tasks in the CITER CIRQ team and the IEM Unit:conducts independent research, coordinates research projects, organizes research-related events and activities, engages in international and national research and stakeholder collaboration, acquires research funding for own research and as part of the team;participates in teaching offered by the unit, as agreed with the candidate during the recruitment process;participation in supervising students writing their thesis concerning sustainable, circular industrial business;participation in various activities of the research group, the unit and stakeholders.The more detailed job description is negotiated and agreed with the candidate during the recruitment process. RequirementsThe Postdoctoral Research Fellow position requires previous completion of a doctoral degree in industrial engineering and management or equivalent.Ability to conduct independent scientific research, and skills for teaching and supervision in the field of the position are required.Orientation on B2B and industrial-scale business is relevant.  We also expect orientation to circular economy business or environmentally sustainable, climate neutral, carbon free, green technologies, clean tech, etc business. The earlier experience can also come from particular industry sector (e.g., chemical process industries or textile; green building and circular construction; sustainable manufacturing; digitalization for circular operations) if industrial management and business perspectives have been applied.Ability and willingness to operate in the crossroads of disciplines is crucial. The research group operates in a multidisciplinary manner, applying business, technology, innovation, sustainability and societal theoretical frameworks, and collaborating with academics and practitioners from these fields.The position requires fluency in the English language and readiness to teach and interact with companies and stakeholders in the Finnish language is considered as a merit.In addition,  international experience and involvement in acquiring research funding are considered as merits. The following criteria are used in screening the applications: Suitability and contribution potential to the research area of the position and the research groupâs work and expertiseMotivation and goals for the postdoctoral positionAchievements in research, teaching and stakeholder interactionLevel of ambition, clarity and feasibility of the research strategyWe offerThe position will be filled for a fixed-term period of 4 years. The planned starting date is 1 May 2022 or as mutually agreed. A trial period of six months applies.The salary will be based on both the position requirements and the employee's personal performance in accordance with the Finnish university salary system. The position of a Postdoctoral Research Fellow is placed on the job demand levels 5-6 (teaching and research staff).
